blackengine.rendering.pipeline.elements

Class Renderer<S extends MaterialShaderProgram,M extends Material<S>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackengine.rendering.pipeline.elements.Renderer<S,M>
  • Type Parameters:
    S -
    M -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    PipelineElement<S>

    public class Renderer<S extends MaterialShaderProgram,M extends Material<S>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements PipelineElement<S>

    • Field Detail

      • shaderProgram

        protected final S extends MaterialShaderProgram shaderProgram
        The shader program that is used to render this renderers targets.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Renderer

        public Renderer(S shaderProgram)
        Default constructor for creating a new instance of Renderer. The render priority will be set to 1.
        Parameters:
        shaderProgram - The shader program that will be used in this renderer.

      • Renderer

        public Renderer(S shaderProgram,
                float renderPriority)
        Constructor for creating a new instance of Renderer.
        Parameters:
        shaderProgram - The shader program that will be used in this renderer.
        renderPriority - A float determining the priority index used to determine the order in the pipeline. A higher priority means it will be rendered earlier in the pipeline.

        public final java.util.stream.Stream<RenderComponent<S,M>> getTargets()
        Getter for the targets that are to be rendered by this instance of Renderer.
        Returns:
        A Stream of all targets that will have to be rendered by this renderer.

      • addTarget

        public void addTarget(RenderComponent<S,M> target)
        Adds a new target to this renderer that will be rendered. If this target is already being rendered, it will not be added.
        Parameters:
        target - The target that will be rendered.

      • containsTarget

        public boolean containsTarget(RenderComponent<S,M> target)
        Checks whether the specified target is being rendered by this renderer.
        Parameters:
        target - The target for which to check its presence in this renderer.
        Returns:
        True if the target is present in this renderer, false otherwise.

      • removeTarget

        public void removeTarget(RenderComponent<S,M> target)
        Removes a target from this renderer so that it will no longer be rendered.
        Parameters:
        target - The target that is to be removed from this renderer.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this renderers shader program, deactivates all targets, and flags this renderer for destruction.
        Specified by:
        destroy in interface PipelineElement<S extends MaterialShaderProgram>
